definitions: ship designed or used specifically for transporting military troops and equipment
examples: The troopship carried thousands of soldiers across the Atlantic
Veterans recalled their cramped conditions aboard the wartime troopship

definitions: commonly used theme, motif, or literary device in artistic works
figure of speech that deviates from literal meaning for rhetorical effect
examples: The reluctant hero is a common trope in fantasy novels
Film critics often discuss overused tropes in romantic comedies
Shakespeare employed various tropes to enhance his dramatic verse
The metaphor remains a powerful trope in political discourse

definitions: decorative object awarded as a prize for victory or achievement
preserved part of hunted animal displayed as evidence of success
examples: The team proudly displayed their championship trophy in the case
She polished her tennis trophies before the awards ceremony
The hunter mounted the deer trophy above his fireplace
Safari trophies lined the walls of the colonial mansion

definitions: either of two latitude circles marking the sun's maximum declination
warm region between the tropical circles characterized by hot climate
examples: The Tropic of Cancer passes through Mexico and India
Ships crossing the tropic often held equator-crossing ceremonies
Many exotic birds migrate to the tropics during winter months
The resort was located in the tropics near pristine beaches

definitions: lowest layer of Earth's atmosphere where weather occurs and temperature generally decreases with altitude
examples: Commercial aircraft typically fly near the top of the troposphere
Most weather phenomena occur within the troposphere's turbulent layers

definitions: moderately fast gait of a horse between walk and canter
brisk running pace slower than a full run for humans
examples: The horse maintained a steady trot around the practice ring
Riders posted to the rhythm of their horses' trot
She broke into a trot to catch the departing bus
The joggers maintained an easy trot through the park

definitions: horse bred and trained specifically for harness racing at a trotting gait
cooked foot of a pig used as food in various cuisines
examples: The champion trotter won races at tracks across the country
Standardbred trotters competed in the harness racing championship
The restaurant served traditional pig's trotters with vinegar
Pickled trotters were displayed in jars at the butcher shop

definitions: medieval lyric poet and musician from southern France who composed and performed songs
traveling singer or entertainer who performs for audiences in various locations
examples: Medieval troubadours composed songs about courtly love and chivalry
The troubadour tradition influenced European poetry for centuries
Modern troubadours perform in subway stations and street corners
The folk troubadour traveled from town to town sharing stories

definitions: state of distress, difficulty, or problems requiring resolution
inconvenience or effort required to accomplish something
examples: The company faced serious financial trouble after losing major clients
She helped friends whenever they were in trouble
Don't go to any trouble preparing dinner for us
It's no trouble at all to drop you at the station

definitions: person who habitually causes problems or stirs up trouble
examples: The teacher separated the troublemakers to maintain classroom order
Known troublemakers were banned from attending the peaceful rally

definitions: long narrow container for feeding or watering animals
lowest point in a wave, cycle, or economic pattern
elongated area of low atmospheric pressure
examples: Farmers filled the trough with fresh water for the cattle
The pig pushed other animals away from the feeding trough
Stock prices hit a trough before beginning their recovery
The business cycle moved from peak to trough repeatedly
A deep trough brought heavy rain to the coastal regions
The weather trough extended from Canada to Mexico

definitions: overwhelming defeat or beating in competition or conflict
examples: The home team suffered a humiliating trouncing in the finals
Critics gave the new policy proposal a thorough trouncing

definitions: organized group of performers such as actors, dancers, or acrobats
examples: The dance troupe toured internationally with their innovative performances
A traveling theater troupe brought Shakespeare to rural communities

definitions: single leg portion of a pair of trousers or pants
examples: He rolled up one trouser leg to show the injury
The tailor hemmed each trouser to the perfect length

definitions: outer garment covering the body from waist to ankles with separate leg portions
examples: He wore formal trousers to the business meeting
The school uniform required grey trousers for all students

definitions: freshwater fish related to salmon, valued for sport fishing and food
examples: The angler caught several rainbow trout in the mountain stream
Fresh trout was the restaurant's specialty dish every Friday

definitions: collection or store of valuable or interesting things discovered or accumulated
examples: Archaeologists discovered a trove of ancient artifacts in the tomb
The library contained a treasure trove of rare manuscripts

definitions: system of weights used for precious metals and gems based on twelve ounces per pound
examples: Gold prices are quoted per troy ounce in international markets
The jeweler weighed the silver using troy measurements

definitions: practice of staying away from school without permission or valid excuse
examples: The school board implemented new policies to reduce student truancy
Chronic truancy often leads to academic failure and dropout

definitions: student who stays away from school without permission
examples: The truant officer searched for students skipping classes
Habitual truants faced suspension from school activities

definitions: agreement between opponents to stop fighting or arguing for a certain time
examples: The warring nations declared a truce during peace negotiations
The siblings called a truce after weeks of constant arguing

definitions: large motor vehicle designed for transporting goods or cargo
wheeled frame supporting each end of a railway car
examples: The delivery truck arrived with furniture for the new office
Semi trucks dominated the interstate highway traffic
Engineers inspected the truck assembly beneath the train car
The railway truck needed replacement after years of service

definitions: person who drives a truck professionally, especially for long-distance hauling
examples: The trucker stopped at the rest area after driving all night
Professional truckers logged thousands of miles each month

definitions: business or industry of transporting goods by truck
examples: The trucking industry faced driver shortages nationwide
Interstate trucking regulations required electronic logging devices

definitions: exact or correct alignment, positioning, or adjustment of something
examples: The carpenter checked that the door frame was true
The wheel needed adjustment to spin true again

definitions: underground fungus prized as a culinary delicacy for its aroma and flavor
soft chocolate candy often round and coated with cocoa or nuts
examples: The chef shaved black truffles over the pasta dish
Trained pigs helped hunters find truffles beneath oak trees
She received a box of handmade chocolate truffles for Valentine's Day
The pastry shop specialized in champagne truffles

definitions: playing card of the suit chosen to rank above others
valuable resource that gives one an advantage
examples: Hearts were declared trump for this round of bridge
She played her last trump to win the trick
His years of experience proved to be his trump card
The company held a trump in the patent negotiations

definitions: brass wind instrument with valves producing bright penetrating tones
loud sound made by an elephant through its trunk
examples: The jazz musician played a soulful solo on his trumpet
Trumpets announced the arrival of the royal procession
The elephant's trumpet echoed across the savanna
Zoo visitors heard the elephants trumpet at feeding time

definitions: person who plays the trumpet professionally or skillfully
large white North American swan known for its trumpeting call
examples: The lead trumpeter performed with major symphony orchestras
Famous trumpeters like Louis Armstrong shaped jazz history
Trumpeter swans migrate through the wetlands each spring
Conservation efforts helped trumpeter swan populations recover

definitions: act of shortening something by cutting off a part or reducing its length
examples: Data truncation occurred when values exceeded the field limit
The truncation of the speech disappointed many attendees

definitions: main woody stem of a tree from ground to branches
storage compartment in the rear of an automobile
elongated muscular nose of an elephant
main part of human body excluding head and limbs
examples: The oak's massive trunk measured six feet in diameter
Initials were carved into the tree trunk decades ago
She loaded the groceries into the car's trunk
The spare tire was stored in the trunk
The elephant used its trunk to spray water
Baby elephants learn to control their trunk movements
Core exercises strengthen the muscles of the trunk
The boxer protected his trunk from body shots

definitions: firm belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something
legal arrangement where property is held by one party for another's benefit
group of companies organized to reduce competition and control prices
examples: Their marriage was built on mutual trust and respect
She earned her students' trust through consistent fairness
The family trust managed investments for future generations
He established a trust fund for his grandchildren's education
The oil trust controlled prices until antitrust laws intervened
Government regulators broke up the railroad trust

definitions: person legally responsible for managing property or affairs for another's benefit
member of a board governing an institution or organization
examples: The trustee managed the estate until the children reached adulthood
Court-appointed trustees handled the bankruptcy proceedings
University trustees voted on the new campus expansion plan
The museum trustees met quarterly to review operations

definitions: position or period of being a trustee with fiduciary responsibilities
administrative control of a territory by another nation under international agreement
examples: His trusteeship of the foundation lasted for ten years
The bank assumed trusteeship of the investment portfolio
The UN trusteeship prepared the territory for independence
Colonial trusteeships gradually transitioned to self-governance

definitions: person who can be relied upon or trusted completely
prisoner granted special privileges for good behavior and reliability
examples: His trusty assistant handled all the confidential matters
The old trusty had served the family for decades
Prison trusties worked outside the walls under minimal supervision
The warden selected trusties to help run the prison library

definitions: quality or state of being in accordance with fact or reality
fact or belief that is accepted as true by consensus or evidence
examples: The investigation revealed the truth about the accident
She struggled to tell the truth about her past
Mathematical truths remain constant across all cultures
Scientific truths evolve with new discoveries and evidence

definitions: effort to do or accomplish something challenging or difficult
scoring play in rugby where ball is grounded in opponent's goal area
examples: Give it another try if you don't succeed initially
Her first try at baking bread turned out perfectly
The winger scored a brilliant try in the corner
The team converted the try for additional points

definitions: test of ability or suitability through performance or demonstration
examples: Basketball tryouts attracted dozens of hopeful players
She prepared extensively for the Broadway show tryouts

definitions: private romantic meeting between lovers, often secret or illicit
examples: The novel described their midnight tryst in the garden
Secret trysts were arranged through coded messages

definitions: emperor of Russia before the 1917 revolution
person appointed to oversee a particular area of government policy
examples: The last tsar of Russia was Nicholas II
Tsars ruled the Russian Empire for centuries
The president appointed a drug tsar to combat narcotics
The energy tsar coordinated national policy initiatives

definitions: empress of Russia or wife of a tsar
examples: The tsarina wielded considerable influence at the imperial court
Alexandra was the last tsarina of Russia

definitions: bloodsucking African fly that transmits sleeping sickness to humans and animals
examples: Tsetse flies made large areas of Africa uninhabitable
Scientists developed traps to control tsetse fly populations

definitions: series of enormous ocean waves caused by underwater earthquakes or volcanic eruptions
examples: The tsunami devastated coastal communities across the Pacific
Warning systems help predict tsunami arrival times

definitions: large container for bathing, typically fixed in a bathroom
wide round container used for storage or washing
examples: She soaked in the hot tub after the marathon
The clawfoot tub was the bathroom's centerpiece
Ice cream came in plastic tubs at the grocery store
Laundry soaked in the wash tub before scrubbing

definitions: largest and lowest-pitched brass instrument with valves and wide bell
examples: The tuba player anchored the brass section's bass line
Marching bands featured sousaphone-style tubas

definitions: hollow cylindrical structure for containing or conveying fluids or objects
underground railway system in London
television set, especially an older cathode-ray model
examples: The mechanic replaced the damaged brake tube
Scientists conducted experiments using glass tubes
Commuters packed into the Tube during rush hour
The Tube map showed all underground lines
Kids spent hours watching cartoons on the tube
The old tube television finally stopped working

definitions: swollen underground stem or root that stores nutrients and produces new plants
examples: Potatoes are tubers that grow beneath the soil surface
Gardeners harvested tubers before the first frost

definitions: small rounded projection or swelling on a bone or organ
small nodular lesion characteristic of tuberculosis infection
examples: The anatomist pointed out the tubercle on the rib bone
X-rays revealed tubercles in the patient's lungs
Tubercles in the lungs indicated active tuberculosis
Microscopic examination confirmed the presence of tubercles

definitions: person suffering from tuberculosis
examples: The sanatorium treated tuberculars from across the region
Many tuberculars recovered in mountain air facilities

definitions: material in the form of tubes or system of tubes
recreational activity of floating down a river on inner tubes
examples: Copper tubing connected the water heater to faucets
Medical tubing delivered oxygen to the patient
Summer tubing trips down the river attracted many tourists
The outfitter rented tubes for tubing adventures
